result.markdown: --- title: "African Countries Facing the Greatest Challenges in Affording Healthy Food" author: "Christmore Setebe | ichidata solutions" date: "2025-07-7" image: "Diet.jpg" page-layout: full format: html --- ::: {.flex .gap-3 .pb-4} [ðŸ“° News](#news){.btn .btn-outline-secondary} [ðŸ’» Code and Visualization](#Code%20and%20Visualization){.btn .btn-outline-secondary} [ðŸ“ˆ Data Storytelling](#Data%20Storytelling){.btn .btn-outline-secondary} ::: ## Explore the Story by Category {.tabset} ### ðŸ“° News Across many low-income nations, over 60% of the population cannot afford a healthy diet. This growing diet decline signals a nutritional emergency where families are forced to choose between essential nutrients and daily survival. As malnutrition rises, so does the urgency to act, ensuring access to nourishing food for all. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### ðŸ’» Code and Visualization ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load required libraries library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'dplyr' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': filter, lag ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:base': intersect, setdiff, setequal, union ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(countrycode) library(ggimage) library(grid) # Dataset diet_data <- data.frame( Location = c( "South Africa", "Belize", "Ghana", "Eswatini", "Angola", "Tanzania", "Lesotho", "Nigeria", "Congo", "Kenya", "Haiti", "Sierra Leone", "Burkina Faso", "Guinea-Bissau", "Liberia", "Uganda", "Rwanda", "Zambia", "Niger", "Central African Republic", "Mozambique", "Burundi", "Malawi", "Democratic Republic of Congo", "Madagascar" ), Income_Classification = c( "Upper-middle-income countries", "Upper-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Lower-middle-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries", "Low-income countries" ), Percentage = c( 61.2, 61.8, 63.0, 65.0, 72.2, 75.5, 76.3, 78.7, 79.1, 79.2, 83.6, 62.5, 63.1, 64.0, 64.1, 72.5, 75.7, 81.7, 86.3, 86.7, 89.3, 89.6, 89.6, 91.4, 93.6 ) ) # Add ISO2 codes diet_data$ISO2 <- countrycode(diet_data$Location, origin = "country.name", destination = "iso2c") diet_data$ISO2[diet_data$Location == "Congo"] <- "cg" diet_data$ISO2[diet_data$Location == "Democratic Republic of Congo"] <- "cd" diet_data$ISO2[diet_data$Location == "Eswatini"] <- "sz" # Add flag URLs diet_data <- diet_data %>% mutate(flag_url = paste0("https://flagcdn.com/w40/", tolower(ISO2), ".png")) # Sort and order diet_data <- diet_data %>% arrange(Percentage) %>% mutate(Location = factor(Location, levels = Location)) # Axis setup x_ticks <- c(0, 25, 50, 75, 100) line_y <- 0.2 tick_height <- 0.4 # Madagascar position madagascar_y <- which(diet_data$Location == "Madagascar") madagascar_x <- diet_data$Percentage[diet_data$Location == "Madagascar"] # Annotation text annotation_text <- paste( "Madagascar:", "9 out of 10", "individuals cannot", "afford to eat healthily", sep = "\n" ) # Plot ggplot(diet_data, aes(x = Percentage, y = Location, fill = Income_Classification)) + # Flags left of bars geom_image(aes(x = -3, image = flag_url), size = 0.04, asp = 1) + # Bars geom_col(width = 0.899) + # Labels on bars geom_text(aes(label = paste0(Percentage, "%")), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5, color = "black") + # Dotted line geom_hline(yintercept = line_y, linetype = "dashed", color = "gray60", linewidth = 0.6) + # Tick marks annotate("segment", x = x_ticks, xend = x_ticks, y = line_y - tick_height / 2, yend = line_y + tick_height / 2, color = "black", linewidth = 1.2) + # Tick labels annotate("text", x = x_ticks, y = line_y - tick_height - 0.1, label = paste0(x_ticks, "%"), size = 3.8, color = "black", fontface = "bold") + # â–¶ï¸ SHORTER ARROW from Madagascar to annotation annotate("segment", x = madagascar_x + 6.0, xend = madagascar_x + 19, y = madagascar_y, yend = madagascar_y - 5, colour = "firebrick", size = 1, arrow = arrow( angle = 30, length = unit(0.3, "cm"), ends = "last", type = "closed" ) ) + # âœ… Fixed: Annotation box on right using `annotate()` instead of `geom_label()` annotate("label", x = 110, y = madagascar_y - 7, label = annotation_text, size = 5, color = "black", fill = "#fef9e7", label.size = 0.6, hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5, lineheight = 1.2 ) + # Labels and legend labs( title = "Countries Where Healthy Diets Are Least Affordable in Africa", subtitle = "Distribution of unaffordable healthy diets across African countries, highlighting the most impacted populations", caption = "Data source: FAO and World Bank (2024)\nVisualization: ichi data solutions", x = "Percentage (%)", y = NULL, fill = "World Bank Income Classification" ) + # Fill colors scale_fill_manual(values = c( "Low-income countries" = "gray71", "Lower-middle-income countries" = "#20c997", "Upper-middle-income countries" = "#f1c40f" )) + # Axis limits coord_cartesian(xlim = c(-5, 115), clip = "off") + # Theme theme_void() + theme( axis.text.y = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0), axis.ticks.y = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14, hjust = 0.5), plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 11, hjust = 0.5), plot.caption = element_text(size = 9, hjust = 0, margin = margin(t = 10)), legend.position = "bottom", plot.margin = margin(10, 30, 60, 20), panel.grid = element_blank() ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. â„¹ Please use `linewidth` instead. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Diet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){fig-align='center' width=3600} ::: ::: ### ðŸ“ˆ Data Storytelling #### ðŸ¥— **Diet Decline Across Africa: A Growing Crisis** Across Africa, millions struggle to afford basic nutritious meals. In low-income countries, like Madagascar and the Democratic Republic of Congo, over 90% of people cannot afford a healthy diet. This crisis also touches lower-middle-income countries such as Nigeria and Kenya, where around 78-79% face the same challenge. Even some upper-middle-income countries , like South Africa, see over 60% unable to meet basic nutrition needs. This widespread diet decline threatens child development, economic productivity, and community well-being. Urgent investment in food systems and nutrition programs is essential to break the cycle and build a healthier future for all.
